alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Floyd; Hale; Swisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 03 at 10:31PM CDT until June 03 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Floyd County in northwestern Texas... Northeastern Hale County in northwestern Texas... Swisher County in the Panhandle of Texas... Briscoe County in the Panhandle of Texas... * Until 1130 PM CDT. * At 1031 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northwest of Claytonville, or 8 miles southeast of Tulia, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Plainview, Tulia, Silverton, Caprock Canyon State Park, Kress, Quitaque, Vigo Park, South Plains, Claytonville, Mackenzie Reservoir, Aiken and Seth Ward. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
